meanings.def: to mention or use a law, rule, etc. as a reason for doing something
examples: It is unlikely that libel laws will be invoked.

meanings.def: to mention a person, a theory, an example, etc. to support your opinions or ideas, or as a reason for something
examples: She invoked several eminent scholars to back up her argument.

meanings.def: to mention somebody’s name to make people feel a particular thing or act in a particular way
examples: His name was invoked as a symbol of the revolution.

meanings.def: to make a request (for help) to somebody, especially a god
to make somebody have a particular feeling or imagine a particular scene
examples: The opening paragraph invokes a vision of England in the early Middle Ages.

meanings.def: to begin to run a program, etc.
examples: This command will invoke the HELP system.

meanings.def: to make evil appear by using magic
